H0.text: Bird beak is the structure most similar to tree bark among many organisms that have structures for protection and survival.

H1.text: Bear claws are the structure most similar to tree bark among the protective and survival structures found in many organisms.

H2.text: Human skin is the structure most similar to tree bark among the protective structures that many organisms possess for protection and survival.

H3.text: Snake fangs are the structure that is most similar to tree bark among the protective and survival structures found in many organisms.
